title.narrative: OUTPUT 4.1 CHILD PROTECTION SYSTEMS

description.narrative: Central 3.1.1 Improve coordination, planning, policy dialogue, advocacy and generation of evidence-based data in support of national strategies to address inequities in access to quality basic education services, participation and retention, which contributes to Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Child Protection - Outcome 4: By 2022, children, adolescents and women are safer and better protected from violence, abuse, exploitation and harm

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Central 3.1.1 Improve coordination, planning, policy dialogue, advocacy and generation of evidence-based data in support ofnational strategies to address inequities in access to quality basic education services, participation and retention

description.narrative: Child Protection system was enhanced through a) a strengthening of the legal protection system by promoting and assisting inter-ministerial workplan of the justice for children; b) supporting birth registration system in both electronic and manual system, and c) strengthening the inter-ministerial coordination in case management by rolling out critical case management guidelines and building the capacity of government staff including social service workforce. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/01/2022
